text: James Paul O'Hara (August 8, 1950 â€“ January 7, 2021) was an American country singer-songwriter and guitarist. He was a member of The O'Kanes. He was known for his number one single "Can't Stop My Heart from Loving You". He was also known for his 1986 hit "Grandpa (Tell Me 'Bout the Good Old Days)" which won him a Grammy Award. O'Hara died in Nashville, Tennessee on January 7, 2021 from cancer at the age of 70. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1950 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Cancer deaths in Tennessee Category:Singers from Ohio Category:Writers from Ohio Category:Musicians from Toledo, Ohio Category:American country singers Category:American country guitarists
title: Jamie O'Hara (singer)
